Transcript:
Buzz: You were a teenager.
You had to go through what no one should have to go through. You were taken
advantage of by this son of a bitch, whoever it was.
Olivia: Whoever it was.

Buzz: It stinks! You didn't ask for any of
it. Your little girl didn't ask for any of it. Ava didn't ask for any of it.
Hate what was done to you, but don't hate her.
Olivia: I can't let it go! I can't!

Buzz: You've got to try with her. You're her
mother. You and Emma are the only family she has. I mean, whatever happens at
that hearing today, that is something you're going to have to deal with.

Olivia: It's been too long. I don't know how
to feel anything for her but hate.

Buzz: You saved her. You saved her. When you
knew who she was. That's not hate. Deep down you don't hate her.

Olivia: Hey, sweetie, come here. Come here.
Were you listening to mommy? Well, I don't hate anyone, okay? Can I tell you
something? Remember when you were in the hospital and you were having those
dreams about your sister, but it wasn't Lizzie? Well, I have something to tell
you. You have another sister. And I want to tell you about her.
Ava: Oop!

Alan-Michael: I think maybe you've had
enough.

Ava: Really? Because last time I remember
the woman who tried to kill me turned out to be my mother. She has a hearing today,
and I might have to send her to jail, and, um, oh, my boyfriend, yeah, he found
out I was adopted and he forgot to tell me.
Alan-Michael: Coop told you he forgot?

Ava: Not really, but good excuse for another
vodka tonic, right?

Alan-Michael: But here's the thing, Ava.
You're in my room.
Ava: So? There's mini bars in ever room.

Alan-Michael: No, what I mean is, while
you're here I'm responsible for you.
Ava: Fine. Then take responsibility.

Coop: She'll come back when she cools off.
Just have a little faith.
Remy: Hey, man.
Marina: Hey, Uncle Henry. What's happening?

Coop: I don't think you guys really want to
know.
Marina: Okay.

Coop: Look, have either of you guys seen Ava
at all?
Marina: Not my day to watch her. (Laughs)
Coop: Thanks.
Marina: Hey, I'm sorry. What's up?

Coop: I made a pretty big mistake, and I
don't know if I can fix it.
Alan: I brought you a cold soda, Elizabeth. How are you feeling?

Lizzie: The same. Maybe if I walked out
there a little bit.

Alan: Elizabeth, doctor's orders, you are to stay in bed. You almost
lost your child.
Lizzie: Yeah.

Alan: Now, I don't blame you at all for
being angry with Jonathan for walking out again on you when you needed him the
most.
Lizzie: He says that he cares about me.

Alan: I know, but I think it's very clear to
you now who really cares for you, and it's your family. Your mother and I will
always be there for you and your baby. Now, listen, sweetheart, I've got to go
take care of some family business, but your mother will be here shortly. So I
think it would be best if you tried to get as much rest as possible.
Beth: Alan?

Alan: Oh, Beth, I was just telling Lizzie
you'd be here.
Beth: How is she?

Alan: Well, she's starting to come around.
Let me know when the doctor decides to release her.

Tammy: We both know it's true, Jonathan. You
have to make a choice. It's the baby or us.
Jonathan: You don't know that.

Tammy: Before yesterday, I really didn’t.
But when we saw Lizzie in trouble, something changed, the way you were with her.
Jonathan: I was worried about the baby.

Tammy: You felt guilty. You felt guilty
because you were with me when they needed you.
Jonathan: No, Tammy, no.

Tammy: I saw it, Jonathan. And it was
killing you, and that killed me. You can't keep this up for the rest of your
life.
Jonathan: Yes, I can.

Tammy: Even if you could, I couldn't let
you. We've been trying to have it both ways for a long time, and it nearly cost
you your baby, and you just don't want to admit that because... because it's
going to cost you me.
Jonathan: I'm not listening to this.
Tammy: Jonathan, please.
Jonathan: You're giving up.

Tammy: When we first got together, it was so
intense, you know? As soon as I thought I couldn't possibly love you any more,
you would prove me wrong. And I felt like I could see things in you that no one
else could see.
Jonathan: You're giving up.

Tammy: But these last few months, you've
shown everyone. And to see you put out there what I knew was in you all along,
it has been an amazing thing, to see how you are about your baby...

Jonathan: But I don't care... I love you, Tammy.
It's always you before the baby, before anything else.

Tammy: You tried to put me first, I know
that.
Jonathan: I'm still trying to put you first.

Tammy: You think I don't care, Jonathan?
This is breaking my heart. I wanted us to spend the rest of our lives together,
too.

Jonathan: And what? I mean, now, you just...
you don't anymore?

Tammy: I'm just saying that we have to get
real.

Jonathan: We are real. This is real. Me and
you is real. I was going to divorce Lizzie. It was going to be the end of the
whole stupid thing between the three of us.

Tammy: We both know it can't have an end. If
anything, this baby is just the beginning.

Jonathan: Well, I don't know. You know, it
could have happened anyway. Even if I was standing right there with Lizzie, she
could have gotten sick, whatever, lost the baby. Even if I was standing right
there, but she didn't, okay? So now everything is fine. It's okay.
Tammy: It's not okay.

Jonathan: I mean, you see one thing in my
face for like a second, and then you change your whole mind about everything?

Tammy: I just can't keep pretending that we
can make this work. We've tried everything. I know that, and you know that,
too.

Jonathan: Stop. Stop. You... this is your
fault.
Tammy: Jonathan.
Beth: I'm going to get you some more water.
Lizzie: I'm really not thirsty.

Beth: Okay. Maybe you'd like something to
read, huh? A magazine?

Lizzie: You and granddad don't have to watch
me every single second.

Beth: Yes, we do, as a matter of fact,
because leaving you alone is what landed you here in the first place. I'm not
going anywhere until we know that that baby is okay.
Lillian: The baby is out of danger.
Lizzie: She is?
Beth: Thank God.

Lillian: They're going to keep you here as
an extra precaution, honey, but if you want to leave, just let me know and I'll
push for it.

Lizzie: No, I'll stay. I mean, I don't want
you to go to any trouble.
Lillian: Oh, honey, it's no trouble.

Beth: No, no, Mom, I'm with Lizzie. I think
that she's making a very mature decision.

Lizzie: Yeah, I don't want the... you know,
baby to be at risk or anything.
Lillian: Is that all, Lizzie?

Lizzie: Well, I mean, Jonathan left in such
a hurry. He might come back to check on me or whatever.

Alan: I'm leaving the hospital now and on my
way to the courthouse. I'll meet you there. We're not leaving until we get the
charges against Olivia dropped. Do you understand? She doesn't have time for
these Ava Peralta games. She has to take care of my granddaughter Emma.
Remy: What about that one?
Marina: No!

Remy: Man, sit down, please. Help us argue
about what color to paint our new place.
Marina: Yeah, he just wants good backup.
Remy: Exactly.

Coop: Well, it's nice that you guys are
trying to get your nice place organized.

Remy: I'm just trying to get a word in
before it becomes two against one.
Coop: Oh, right. Tammy.

Marina: You know, I think I should be the one who's worried
about being the loser on the outside here. Once Tammy moves in, this one is not
going to listen to a word I say.

Coop: I forget you had a little thing for
her. You know, it's dangerous territory, right?
Remy: Dude, all women are dangerous.

Coop: Yeah, I agree, but not all women come
with Jonathan Randall lurking around.

Marina: Thank you, Coop. Now I will have two lovesick dogs
on my hands.

Coop: Hey, I am fine, all right? I haven't
thought about Ava once today. Lynn, have you seen Ava at all? Stop, okay? Just don't

know if she stopped by Co2 at all?
Lynn: Sorry, Coop. Did you try her cell?

Coop: I could try her again. Thank you. I...
I... hey, what are you...? That's my phone.
Marina: Ava will come back when she has calmed down, okay?

Ava: Isn't this an Olivia move or what? I
throw myself-- tipsy self-- at the first rich and powerful guy who takes me
back to his room just to make myself feel better.

Alan-Michael: For the record, I didn't take
you back here. You invited yourself in.

Olivia: Well, did you see that? That was
like the best news I could have given her.

Buzz: Well, it's not every day a little girl
finds out she has a new big sister.

Olivia: Yeah, well, she's a kid. She doesn't
understand how complicated things get.
Buzz: I'm so glad you did that.

Olivia: She's going to hear it, eventually.
I wanted her to hear it from me.
Buzz: Did it help? Seeing how happy she was?

Olivia: She's happy when she gets a prize
out of a cereal box, Buzz. She's a little girl.

Buzz: You know what I mean. Nothing can
erase all the suffering you went through. Nothing can make you live with it
anymore, but...

Olivia: You just want me to stop hating Ava,
just like that?

Buzz: I know you wanted nothing to do with
the girl you gave away. I know you thought you hated Ava before you knew who
she was, but you brought two girls into the world. You're their mother; you're
their connection. So if you can't do it for your own good, do it for theirs.

Olivia: Stop. This is not for you to worry
about, all right?
Buzz: Oh, come on, why do you do this?
Olivia: Please stop it.

Buzz: I'm on your side. Can't you see that?
Well, go ahead. Keep throwing me curve balls! I might not hit them all out of
the park but, you know, I'll keep swinging. I'm with you.

Olivia: I can't talk about this right now. I
can't do it.

Buzz: There's something we have to talk
about.
Olivia: Fine, what?

Buzz: You leaving this house and coming home
with me.
(knock at door)
Alan-Michael: Right there.
Coop: What happened?

Alan-Michael: I think it all hit her just
now.
Coop: How much do you know?

Alan-Michael: Enough. Just take care of her,

Coop: Hey. I was looking for you.
Ava: You found me.

Coop: Uh-huh. Look, I'm sorry about what
happened. There’s... there's a lot I have to tell you.

Alan-Michael: Hey, they found the guy, Ava,

against Olivia.
Ava: How did you do that?

Alan-Michael: I made him an offer, and he
took it.

Ava: He did? Thank you so much. Thank you.
Thank you.
Coop: Thanks. Okay, let's go.

Buzz: Okay, Emma’s still with the nanny, but

Olivia: He's Emma’s grandfather.
Buzz: Which he's holding over you.

Buzz: But what? Let me help you. Come on, I

Olivia: Okay, all right, maybe you're right.

Olivia: You know why I went to him when I
got myself into this mess, don't you?

Buzz: Well, yeah, because Spaulding goes a

you.

Buzz: You don't have to worry about that.
You have to worry about being in debt to Alan Spaulding.

Alan-Michael: Forget him. You've got bigger
problems.

Lillian: All right, so you hold with both
legs in order to put the diaper on.

Beth: And I'm going to tell you right now,
honey, there is a difference. Get the pampers. They're the best.

Lillian: Keep her very clean. Before you put
the diaper on, you've got to keep her clean.

Lizzie: How long do you think Jonathan’s
been gone?

Beth: Lizzie, you have to pay attention to

Beth: No, honey, you have to watch this very

Lillian: Lizzie, I have been supportive of

Lillian: I do understand. It's about the

Beth: All right, okay, Mom, I think that you
should go.

Beth: I need to spend a little time alone

Beth: But maybe me yelling at you is just
the kick in the butt you need.
Tammy: Jonathan.

Jonathan: I didn't want to have this baby in
the first place, but you kept pushing me and pushing me. You told me to do the

us. "Jonathan, don't let this kid grow up without a dad." Damn it! If
you just let me do what I wanted to do!

Tammy: Maybe I pushed you to do the right
thing, but you got there on your own. You came around to wanting your baby.
Jonathan: No, you made me.

Tammy: No! No. You don't ever do anything
that you don't want to do. That's not you.

Jonathan: Yeah, that's not me? Well, you
want to know what is you? You're a liar.
Tammy: Don't say that.

Jonathan: You promised me that you were
going to stay with me no matter what and that you were going to help me raise
this kid, and now you're going to back out on me.

Tammy: Lizzie's going to be a great mother.
She'll be great, and you have Reva.

Jonathan: I have... that's your... oh, man.
Oh!

Tammy: I'm losing something here, too, you
know? You're going to have this brand- new family, and I don’t... I don't even
know what's next for me without you.

Jonathan: I knew it. I knew as soon as I
started to feel something for the baby that...
Tammy: That you would have to love me less.

Jonathan: I have never loved you less. I
mean, the baby's not even born yet, it doesn't even have a name, but, I don't
know, when I saw the blood...

Tammy: I know, I know. That you just can't
hide it anymore, Jonathan. We can't keep fighting like this. We can’t. We can’t.

Jonathan: You know how you said before that
I never do anything I don't want to do? I don't want to do this, but I guess I
have to.
Kim Zimmer, "Inside The Light."

Billy and Reva are so much alike. They're
both people who are obsessive, um... compulsive. They are spontaneous. They're

See Reva, Wednesday, October 25, "Inside

Ava: Maybe I would have done the same thing,

Alan-Michael: It'll take the edge off.
Buzz: We were just leaving.

Buzz: What has this woman done to you?

Alan-Michael: My house. I just let you live

Alan: You'll have to excuse my son. Ever

Alan: Well, so I just heard.

Alan: You'll have to trust me on this one.
Buzz: Let's go.
